feed.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core

entry.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
entry.summary: In the ongoing discussion regarding Bitcoin development, a significant suggestion was made concerning the handling of Replace-By-Fee (RBF) transactions. A recent comment in a pull request highlighted the proposal to enable full RBF by default, a change from the current modality. This suggestion comes in light of a previous pull request that was closed due to off-topic commentary. The dialogue around this shift hints at underlying tensions, with accusations of politicizing the issue being directed towards individuals involved in the debate. This discourse reflects the complexities and the intricacies of managing changes within Bitcoin's protocol, showcasing the balance between technical advancements and community consensus.
